Name: Parmenides
Ingredients: 10 ml Green Chartreuse (or alternative herbal liqueur)
20 ml Sugar syrup 'rich' (2 sugar to 1 water, 65.0°Brix)
Instructions: Select and pre-chill a Coupe glass .
Review: A sour-style cocktail served straight-up combining brandy, Green Chartreuse, white wine and lemon.
History: Adapted from a recipe created in 2015 by Fabiano Latham when he was at The Natural Philosopher in London, England. Parmenides was a 6th century BC Greek philosopher, appropriate considering the name of Alban's bar.
Nutrition: One serving of Parmenides contains 214 calories
